page.title: 16Change,1939_45,Fauldhouse
page.content: These were the second world war years. {Housing}Had improved a little .People now have two rooms with set in beds, small scullery and indoor toilet . {Schooling}Changed not at all. Still 40 or more to a class you had to buy your own jotters and slatecomb. Leaving age 14. Discipline still very strict with corporal punishment. {Work}Was mainly mining. Girls went to domestic service or shops. Some joined the Armed Forces and worked in the munitions factories,wages were low and people were poor. {Transport}Mainly trains and buses. Not many cars . Horses and carts still carrying and delivering most things. {Food} During the war was very scarce. Everyone had a ration.People grew most of their own vegetable.There were more tinned foods but still no frozen foods in the shops.
